member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.SymbolMarshal
member.summary: The SymbolMarshal class is used to marshal managed data into native data and vice versa.
member.remarks: This class is not CLS Compliant.

member.name: F:Symbol.Marshaller.SymbolMarshal.NULL
member.summary: The NULL field returns an IntPtr with value 0. Used in marshal operations.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.SymbolMarshal.MarshalStructInfoTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marshals (copies) managed code structinfo information into the native buffer.
member.param: An IntPtr that points to the native buffer.
The offset from the start of the native buffer where the struct info resides.
The amount of bytes allocated in the native structure defined by the struct info.
The amount of used bytes in the native structure as defined by the struct info.
member.returns: An offset that indicates the next part of the native buffer.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.SymbolMarshal.UnmarshalStructInfoFrom(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unmarshals (extracts and checks) managed information from the struct info in the native buffer.
member.param: An IntPtr that points to the native buffer.
The offset from the start of the native buffer where the struct info resides.
The amount of bytes allocated in the native structure defined by the struct info.
The amount of used bytes in the native structure as defined by the struct info.
member.returns: An offset that indicates the next part of the native buffer.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.SymbolMarshal.MarshalTimeStampTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert DateTime in managed code to native SYSTEMTIME.
member.param: An IntPtr that points to the native buffer.
The offset from the start of the native buffer.
A DateTime object that contains the time information.
member.returns: An offset that indicates the next part of the native buffer.

The offset from the start of the native buffer.
A DateTime object that will contain the time information.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.RSMAPI
member.summary: The class for the RSM (Remote Scanner Management) API. It provides the list of RSM attributes. An object of this class gets created by the Barcode object automatically. Application should not attempt to instantiate an object of this class. NOTE: The RSM feature can only be used when using remote scanner devices such as RS507.

example.code:
' Create the Barcode Reader object using the first available scanner Dim MyReader As Symbol.Barcode.Reader = Nothing MyReader = New Symbol.Barcode.Reader()
' Enable the Reader MyReader.Actions.Enable()
' Read the current and factory default values of the model number attribute Dim txtModelNumber As String = MyReader.RSM.ModelNumber.CurrentValue Dim txtFdfltModelNumber As String = MyReader.RSM.ModelNumber.FactoryDefaultValue
' Write the Bluetooth PIN code Dim bBTEncryption As Boolean = MyReader.RSM.BluetoothEncryption.CurrentValue
' Check if the PIN code attribute is supported and modify it If MyReader.RSM.BluetoothPINCode.IsSupported Then MyReader.RSM.BluetoothPINCode.CurrentValue = "12346" End If
' Disable the Reader object MyReader.Actions.Disable()
' Dispose the Reader object MyReader.Dispose()

member.summary: The constructor.

member.summary: Provides access to model number. The maximum length of the attribute value is 18.

member.summary: Provides access to serial number. The maximum length of the attribute value is 16. NOTE: Only current value is relevant for this attribute.

member.summary: Provides access to date of scanner device manufacture. The maximum length of the attribute value is 7. NOTE: Only current value is relevant for this attribute.

member.summary: Provides access to the reconnect attempts parameter of the scanner device.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.RSMAPI.rsmReconnectAttempts.CurrentValue
member.summary: Provides the current value of the attribute. Indicates the time duration during which the scanner tries to reestablish the connection, when it goes out of range. Use the value: 6 for 30 secs duration 7 for 35 secs duration 8 for 40 secs duration 9 for 45 secs duration 10 for 50 secs duration 11 for 55 secs duration 12 for 60 secs duration

member.summary: Provides the current value of the attribute. False – (default) Use PIN code stored in memory of Bluetooth device. The default PIN stored in memory is “12345”. True – Prompt the user to scan a new PIN code using the Bluetooth device. This attribute is not saved permanently on the Bluetooth device.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Actions
member.summary: Performs actions on the Reader.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Barcode.Actions is used to perform actions on the scanner hardware. Such actions include starting and canceling pending reads, as well as, enabling and disabling the hardware. The class is normally contructed by the class during its instantiation process.

member.name: T:Symbol.Generic.Actions
member.summary:
The Generic.Actions base class provides access to common methods that are used by all Generic.Reader objects.
NOTE: This class has been deprecated.
member.remarks: The Generic.Actions object can be used to perform common actions on a specific Reader (such as Barcode.Reader or MagStripe.Reader). This allows common code to be created that acts on any Reader.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Enable
member.summary: Puts the device in a state in which information can be read from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Disable
member.summary: Puts the device in a state in which information can no longer be read from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Flush
member.summary: Removes all pending reads from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Read(Symbol.Generic.ReaderData)
member.summary: Initiates a read from the device. This method simply puts the class in a state in which data can be read. Commonly, some other action must take place before the read will actually complete (such as pressing a scan trigger or swiping a magnetic striped card).
member.param: A Generic.ReaderData object that will contain the data.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.NewReaderData
member.summary: Returns a new Generic.ReaderData object that can be used with the Generic.Read function.
member.returns: A new Generic.ReaderData object.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all native resources back to the system.
member.remarks: This method is normally called by the derived classes that instantiate the object.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Finalize
member.summary: Allows an Action object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Dispose
member.summary: Release any resources used by the Actions class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Enable
member.summary: Enables the scanner hardware. This method does not make the scanner scan or turn on the laser.
member.remarks: The Enable() method may take a while to process due to that fact that it instantiates the ScanParamsAPI, DecoderAPI, and UPCANParamsAPI, and Version objects. During this time the WaitCursor will be displayed on the screen. The Enable() method allows this initialization to be done when it least impacts the user experience (e.g. entry to a form). To perform the scan of a barcode additional methods must be called.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Disable
member.summary: Disables the scanner hardware. Reverses the process. The scanner must be re-enabled before its use if it has been disabled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Read(Symbol.Generic.ReaderData)
member.summary: Starts a pending read. The method will not turn on the laser. It will, however, put the scanner in a state in which the laser can be turned on either by pressing a hardware trigger or by performing a software trigger.
member.param: The ReaderData object that will contain the scanned data once the read completes.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Flush
member.summary: Removes all pending reads from the Reader.
member.remarks: Calling Flush method is same as calling method for all pending reads.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.CancelRead(Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData)
member.summary: Removes a single pending read from the Reader. This method will only work if the given ReaderData object is still in a pending read situation (i.e. the read has been submitted but no notification of a read completion or failure has occurred).
member.param: A ReaderData object that has a pending read.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.ToggleSoftTrigger
member.summary: Toggles the soft trigger of the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.NewReaderData
member.summary:
Creates a generic ReaderData object for use with a Symbol.Barcode.Reader object.
NOTE: This method has been deprecated and will not be supported. Please use the Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData class to create a ReaderData object.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Generic base classes provide a level of abstraction for data providers such as Barcode Readers and Magnetic Stripe Readers. This abstraction provides application developers with the capability to write generic code that can be used across different data providers and hardware. Since only common functionality is provided by the Generic classes, some specific features may be lost.
member.returns: A generic ReaderData object.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.SetParameters
member.summary:
All changes in decoder parameters, reader parameters, UPCEAN parameters, Scanner parameters and Interface parameters will be applied to the barcode that will be read immediately.
NOTE: Beginning with the ScanMDD file version 6.01, the InterfaceParameters object can be accessed before or after enabling the Reader object. In the earlier versions of ScanMDD, the InterfaceParameters object can only be accessed after enabling the Reader object. The ScanMDD version can be retrieved using the ControlPanel tool available on the support central website.
member.remarks: If this function is not called after making modifications to any of these parameters, then the changes would take effect only after the completion of any pending reads.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.GetParameters
member.summary:
Get decoder parameters, reader parameters, interface parameters, UPCEAN parameters and Scanner parameters from the underlying API.
NOTE: Beginning with the ScanMDD file version 6.01, the InterfaceParameters object can be accessed before or after enabling the Reader object. In the earlier versions of ScanMDD, the InterfaceParameters object can only be accessed after enabling the Reader object. The ScanMDD version can be retrieved using the ControlPanel tool available on the support central website.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.DoRemoteFeedBack(Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams)
member.summary: Provides Beep and/or LED feedback on the remote scanner.
member.param: RemoteFeedbackParams object that contains the feedback parameters
member.remarks: This feature is available only on remote scanners with feedback capabilites like RS507. To determine if this feature is available check the IsFeedbackSupported property in Reader.Info object.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.StartStatusThread
member.summary: Start status monitoring thread

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams
member.summary:
This class provides access to the feedback parameters on the remote scanner.
NOTE: The Remote feedback feature is available only on remote scanners with feedback capabilites like RS507. To determine if this feature is available check the IsFeedbackSupported property in Reader.Info object.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams.BeepTime
member.summary: A value of zero (0) indicates no beep and a value is greater then zero (>0) enables the beep.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams.BeepFrequency
member.summary: Provides the beep frequency.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams.LEDTime
member.summary: Provides the LED time duration in milliseconds. A value of zero (0) indicates no LED used in feedback.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.RemoteFeedbackParams.WaveFile

member.name: T:Symbol.API
member.summary: The API Base class provides a common foundation for all classes that in the EMDK for .NET class libraries that will work with the StandardForms functionality.
member.remarks: The API class provides the capability of "reflecting" through objects to gain information at runtime about their properties. This capability provides an excellent way for application developers to create UI for parameters they may not necessarilly be familiar with. This class is abstract and as such may never be instantiated as is.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.#ctor
member.summary: Default API constructor.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Abstract method that provides the capability of saving an API objects properties/parameters.
member.param: A boolean flag that when true performs a deep copy of the parameters, otherwise a shallow copy is performed.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters is returned.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Abstract method provides the capability to restore previously saved API object parameters.
member.param: An object that represents the saved API parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetProperties
member.summary: Returns all parameter/property information for the API object.
member.returns: An array of PropertyAttributes are returned. The array contains all the properties with meta-data that can be used for UI purposes.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns all parameter/property information for the API object.
member.param: A boolean flag that specifies whether or not to return optional parameters in the PropertyAttribute array.
member.returns: An array of PropertyAttributes are returned. The array contains all the properties with meta-data that can be used for UI purposes.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetPropertyClass(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: This method can be used to obtain subclass information for nested API derived objects within an API object.
member.param: The class type of the Parent Class.
The class type of the Child Class.
member.returns: Returns an PropertyClassAttribute object for a given class type.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.Text
member.summary: The text property provides a inherited class specific string.
member.value: A string that describes the API object.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.IsSupported
member.summary: A virtual property that may or may not be overridden for a derived API object.
member.value: A boolean flag. Returns true if not overridden.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.Changes
member.summary: Provides the ability to saving and restoring of API object parameters.
member.value: An InfoChanges object that performs actions on the API object.

member.name: T:Symbol.API.InfoChanges
member.summary: The InfoChanges class is used internally to help with the saving and restoring process.
member.remarks: The InfoChanges class is created by the API abstract class and is used to provide the recursive save feature. The InfoChanges object can be access using API.Changes property.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.#ctor(Symbol.API)
member.summary: InfoChanges constructor is called internally to the class libraries.
member.param: An API based object to save and restore information.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.Save
member.summary: Saves all properties/parameters for the given API object recursively.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.SaveEx(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves all properties/parameters for the given API object.
member.param: A boolean flag. If true a deep copy of the parameters will be made, otherwise a shallow copy will be made.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Abstract method provides the capability to restore previously saved API object parameters.
member.param: An object that represents the saved API parameters.

member.name: T:Barcode.CodeIdTypes
member.summary: Describes the type of Code ID to be reported.
member.remarks:
The (legacy) Symbol Technologies, Inc. CodeIDs are documented in the following table:
Code Type Symbol Tech. Identifier
UPC-A, UPC-E, UPC-E1, UPC-E0, EAN-13, EAN-8 A
Code 39, Code 39 Full ASCII, Code 32 B
Codabar C
Code 128, ISBT 128 D
Code 93 E
Interleaved 2 of 5 F
Discrete 2 of 5, D 2 of 5 IATA G
MSI Plessey J
UCC/EAN 128 K
Bookland EAN L
Trioptic Code 39 M
UPC/EAN Coupon Code N
PDF417 X
Data Matrix P00
Maxicode P02
US Postnet P03
US Planet P04
Japan Postal P05
UK Postal P06
Australian Postal P09

member.name: F:Barcode.CodeIdTypes.None
member.summary: No Code ID.

member.name: F:Barcode.CodeIdTypes.Symbol
member.summary: Use (legacy) Symbol Technologies Code ID.

member.name: F:Barcode.CodeIdTypes.AIM
member.summary: Use AIM Code ID.

member.name: T:Barcode.ScanTypes
member.summary: The type of scan requests.

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Foreground
member.summary: Foreground reads take priorty over background reads. When submitting a foreground read the application should be the topmost window.

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Background
member.summary: Background reads can be superceded by foreground reads. Background reads are usually submitted by background applications such as a scan wedge program.

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Monitor
member.summary: Monitor reads provide a way in which programs can listen in on all scans that take place.

If the product does not support I2C or if using an older engine the default value for DBP Mode is DBP_NORMAL. An attempt to change this mode to DBP_COMPOSITE will result in an E_SCN_NOTSUPPORTED error.

member.summary: Focus mode to use.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.FocusPosition
member.summary: Focus position to use.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.PoorQuality1DMode
member.summary: This parameter allows poor quality 1D barcodes to be read, BUT adversely affecting the overall decoding performance.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.PicklistMode
member.summary: This parameter allows the imager to decode only the barcode that is directly under the cross-hair/reticule (+) part of the AIM pattern. This feature is most useful in applications where multiple barcodes may appear in the field of view during a decode session and only one of them is targeted for decode. When enabled, PicklistMode will override AimMode if no aiming is chosen and use the AIM_MODE_RETICLE mode. When enabled, PicklistMode may adversely affect overall decoding performance. ENABLE – Enables picklist mode, so only the barcode under the cross-hair can be decoded. DISABLE – Disables picklist mode, so any barcode within the field of view can be decoded.
member.remarks: When both PicklistMode and PicklistModeEx are set by the user, PicklistModeEx takes precedance over PicklistMode.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.PicklistModeEx
member.summary: This parameter allows the imager to decode only the barcode that is directly under the cross-hair/center of the reticle. This feature is most useful in applications where multiple barcodes may appear in the field of view during a decode session and only one of them is targeted for decode. When enabled, PicklistModeEx will override AimMode if no aiming is chosen and use the AIM_MODE_RETICLE mode. When enabled, PicklistModeEx may adversely affect overall decoding performance. Also read note on interaction between the picklist modes and the viewfinder modes (only for imagers that support viewfinder capability). PICKLIST_DISABLED – Disables picklist mode, so any bar code within the field of view can be decoded. PICKLIST_HARDWARE_RETICLE – Enables picklist mode so that only the barcode under the projected reticle can be decoded. If the imager does not support a projected reticle then the behavior is same as that of PICKLIST_SOFTWARE_RETICLE.
member.remarks: When both PicklistMode and PicklistModeEx are set by the user, PicklistModeEx takes precedance over PicklistMode.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.DPMMode
member.summary: This parameter allows Direct Part Marking (DPM) bar codes to be read but may adversely affect overall decoding performance. Direct Part Marking is a way of stamping bar codes directly on physical objects. Support for this feature is available on DPM terminals only. If this feature is not available and user attempts to enable it, an error (E_SCN_NOTSUPPORTED) will result.
member.remarks: This feature cannot be turned on in conjunction with Picklist as both these modes are mutually exclusive. An attempt to turn on both will result in an error (E_SCN_NOTSUPPORTED).

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.IlluminationMode
member.summary: Illumination Mode to use.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.VFPosition
member.summary: Specifies the coordinates of the viewfinder on the screen. When scanning is enabled via an imager that supports the viewfinder, the user can enable the viewfinder which helps with locating the barcode. The images displayed on the viewfinder will be scaled to fit in the area specified.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.VFMode
member.summary: Viewfinder modes supported for scanning.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.VFFeedback
member.summary: This parameter allows selection of the different feedback parameters on a successful decode.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.VFFeedbackTime
member.summary: Time (in milli seconds) for which the visual display selected by VFFeedback is shown.

member.name: P:Barcode.ReaderParams.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.Inverse1DMode
member.summary: This parameter allows the user to select decoding on inverse 1D barcodes.

member.name: T:Barcode.AIM_TYPE
member.summary: Describes the type of aiming to use.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_TRIGGER
member.summary: Dual-stage trigger based aiming; The standard triggering mode that remains idle until the trigger is pressed. Once the trigger is pressed a decode session is started. The decode session remains active until a barcode is decoded, the BeamTimer is expired or the trigger is released.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_TIMED_HOLD
member.summary: Timed hold aim type; The scan status is idle until the trigger is pressed. Once pressed an aiming session is started for a time specified by AimDuration, when this time expires a decode session is started. The decode session will remain active until the BeamTimer expires, the trigger is released or a barcode is decoded.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_TIMED_RELEASE
member.summary: Timed release aim type; The scan status is idle until the trigger is pressed. Once pressed an aiming session is started and will continue until the trigger is released.If the AimDuration is expired when the trigger is released then a decode session will be started for a remaining time equal to BeamTimer or a barcode is decoded.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_PRESS_AND_RELEASE
member.summary: Press and release aim type; the scan status goes from idle to scanning by pressing and releasing the trigger. The decode session will remain active until the BeamTimer expired or a barcode is decoded. This is not a valid setting for the laser barcode readers.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_PRESENTATION
member.summary: Presentaion aim type; Appears idle until motion is detected in front of imager window at which time illumination is turned on along with the aiming pattern and a decode is attempted. Currently only the MK500 device supports this feature.

member.name: F:Barcode.AIM_TYPE.AIM_TYPE_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined.

member.name: T:Barcode.PICKLIST_MODE
member.summary: Enumerates the different picklist modes.

member.name: F:Barcode.PICKLIST_MODE.PICKLIST_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables picklist mode, so any bar code within the field of view can be decoded.

member.name: F:Barcode.PICKLIST_MODE.PICKLIST_HARDWARE_RETICLE
member.summary: Enables picklist mode so that only the barcode under the projected reticle can be decoded. If the imager does not support a projected reticle then the behavior is same as that of PICKLIST_SOFTWARE_RETICLE.

member.name: F:Barcode.PICKLIST_MODE.PICKLIST_SOFTWARE_RETICLE
member.summary: Enables the picklist mode so that only the barcode in the center of the image is decoded. This is most useful when used in conjunction with the static and dynamic reticle viewfinder modes.

member.name: F:Barcode.PICKLIST_MODE.PICKLIST_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined.

member.name: T:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE
member.summary: Imager Specific Viewfinder Modes

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE.VIEWFINDER_MODE_DISABLED
member.summary: Viewfinder disabled. Viewfinder is not displayed during aiming or scanning.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE.VIEWFINDER_MODE_ENABLED
member.summary: Viewfinder enabled. Displays the images captured by the camera on the screen.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE.VIEWFINDER_MODE_STATIC_RETICLE
member.summary: Viewfinder enabled with locate reticle. Displays the viewfinder as well as draws a red reticle in the center of the screen which helps with tracking the barcode.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE.VIEWFINDER_MODE_DYNAMIC_RETICLE
member.summary: Viewfinder enabled with dynamic reticle. Displays the viewfinder as well as draws a red reticle in the center of the image. If the barcode in the image is ‘decodable’ the reticle turns green to indicate this.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_MODE.VIEWFINDER_MODE_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined.

member.name: T:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK
member.summary: Imager Specific Viewfinder Feedback Modes

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK_DISABLED
member.summary: Viewfinder feedback disabled. This mode disables any visual feedback on a successful decode.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK_ENABLED
member.summary: Viewfinder feedback enabled. This mode displays the last image that successfully decoded. The duration for which the image is displayed can be set by the VFFeedbackTime.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK_RETICLE
member.summary: Viewfinder enabled with decode reticle. This mode displays the last image that successfully decoded and also draws a reticle in the center of the image.

member.name: F:Barcode.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK.VIEWFINDER_FEEDBACK_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined.

member.name: T:Barcode.INVERSE1D_MODE
member.summary: Enumerated inverse iD modes.

member.summary: Disables decoding of inverse 1D symbologies.

member.name: F:Barcode.INVERSE1D_MODE.INVERSE_ENABLE
member.summary: Enables decoding of only inverse 1D symbologies.

member.name: F:Barcode.INVERSE1D_MODE.INVERSE_AUTO
member.summary: Allows decoding of both positive as well as inverse 1D symbologies.

member.name: F:Barcode.INVERSE1D_MODE.INVERSE_UNDEFINED
member.summary: Undefined.

member.name: T:Barcode.ISBT128_CONCAT_MODE
member.summary: Enumerated ISBT128 concatenation modes.

member.name: F:Barcode.ISBT128_CONCAT_MODE.NEVER
member.summary: Will ignore the barcode pair and only output decode data for only one of the barcodes

member.name: F:Barcode.ISBT128_CONCAT_MODE.ALWAYS
member.summary: Will not decode if both the barcodes are not present or if one of them cannot be decoded

member.name: F:Barcode.ISBT128_CONCAT_MODE.AUTO
member.summary: Auto-discriminate

member.name: F:Barcode.ISBT128_CONCAT_MODE.UNDEFINED

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Reader
member.summary: The Barcode.Reader class can be considered the primary class of the Barcode class library. It provides access to actions, information, and parameters.
member.remarks:
The Reader class provides all the capabilities of the scanner. It is normally constructed by having a object passed in as a parameter. Once created, actions can be performed on the reader using object returned from the property. One of the most commonly used actions is the submitting of a request. To perform a Read you will need to contruct a object and pass it as a parameter to the Read method. You will then need to attach to the event to be notified when a read completes.
Decoder and scan parameter objects can be access using the Reader.Decoders and Reader.Parameters properties, respectively.
The Dispose method of the Reader should be called when the object is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor
member.summary: Default Reader constructor creates an instance using the first available device.
member.remarks: The first available device may be a Simulated device if no scanning hardware is found. To be sure that the correct device is targeted during the instantiation of the Reader, it is suggested that you specify the Device fully using the other Reader constructors.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Reader constructor with settable device name.
member.param: A string that contains the device name of the hardware to access. This is normally of the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor(Symbol.Generic.Device)
member.summary: Reader constructor with settable Barcode.Device.
member.remarks: This is the recommended constructor to use when creating a Reader object.
member.param: A Generic.Device or object that targets a particular scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a Reader to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Dispose
member.summary: Frees up all resources used by the Reader, including any objects it has created. It is strongly recommended that this method be called when the Reader is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.GetNextReaderData
member.summary: Gets the next ReaderData object from the read completion queue.
member.remarks: The GetNextReaderData method is most commonly called by methods that have been invoked via the ReadNotify event. This method provides access to the ReaderData object of completed reads (whether the reads have been completed successfully or not should be determined from the status information provided by the ReaderData object).
member.returns: A object that has completed.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.GetNextStatus
member.summary: Gets the next BarcodeStatus object from the scan status event queue.
member.remarks: The GetNextStatus method is most commonly called by methods that have been invoked via the StatusNotify event. This method provides access to the BarcodeStatus object that contains information about the scan event that has occured.
member.returns: A object with scan event information.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.ToString
member.summary: String representation of class.
member.returns: The device name of the Reader in string form.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later if necessary.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: E:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.ReadNotify
member.summary: Attach to this notification event to be called back when a read completes.
member.value: A delegate of the method that will be invoked when a read completes.

member.name: E:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.StatusNotify
member.summary: Attach to this notification event to be called back when a scan event occurs.
member.value: A delegate of the method that will be invoked when a scan event occurs.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Actions
member.summary: Provides access to actions that can be performed on the Reader.
member.value: A object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Info
member.summary: Provides access to information about the Reader.
member.value: A object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Version
member.summary: Provides access to version information.
member.value: A object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Text
member.summary: Returns the name of the device being used for the Reader.
member.value: String that contains the Device name

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Decoders
member.summary: Provides access to Decoder-specific parameters so that they can be viewed and modified.
member.value: A object that contains the decoders.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Parameters
member.summary: Provides access to scan-specific parameters so that they can be viewed and modified.
member.value: A object that contains the scan parameters.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.ReaderParameters
member.summary: Provides access to Reader-specific parameters so that they can be viewed and modified.
member.value: A object that contains the reader parameters.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.UPCEAN
member.summary: Provides access to UPC/EAN-specific parameters so that they can be viewed and modified.
member.value: A object that contains the parameters.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.RSM
member.summary: Provides access to RSM (Remote Scanner Management) attributes so that they can be viewed and modified. The Reader must be enabled before accessing RSM attributes. NOTE: The RSM feature can only be used when using remote scanner devices such as RS507.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.InterfaceParameters
member.summary:
Provides access to Interface-specific parameters so that they can be viewed and modified.
NOTE: Beginning with the ScanMDD file version 6.01, the InterfaceParameters object can be accessed before or after enabling the Reader object. In the earlier versions of ScanMDD, the InterfaceParameters object can only be accessed after enabling the Reader object. The ScanMDD version can be retrieved using the ControlPanel tool available on the support central website.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI
member.summary: The DecoderParamsAPI Class contains decoder parameters that are used by multiple decoder symbologies.
member.remarks: The DecoderParamsAPI class provides access to such decoder parameters as Enabled and IsSupported, among others. This class is derived from Symbol.API and therefore can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Text
member.summary: The Text property returns the name of the Decoder.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.IsSupported
member.summary: Returns whether or not the Decoder is supported by the Reader.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Enabled
member.summary: Returns whether or not the Decoder is currently enabled.
member.value: Boolean flag that specifies state (true=enable,false=disable).

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI
member.summary: The DecoderAPI class provides access to decoder specific parameters.
member.remarks: This class is derived from Symbol.API and therefore can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The DecoderAPI constructor is normally called by the Reader class during the Reader.Actions.Enable. The created object can be accessed using the Reader.Decoders property. The constructor should not be called by the user.
member.param: A Reader object to obtain decoder information from.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.Title(System.String)
member.summary: The Title method takes a given string and appends " Parameters:" to it. It is used internally to generate title string for UI purposes.
member.param: String object that contains first part of title.
member.returns: String object that contains title for UI.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.IsEnabled(Symbol.Barcode.DecoderTypes)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the given decoder is currently enabled.
member.param: A DecoderTypes enum that specifies a particular decoder.
member.returns: A boolean flag which is true if enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.SetEnabled(Symbol.Barcode.DecoderTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not a specified decoder should be enabled.
member.param: A DecoderTypes enum that specifies a particular decoder.
A boolean flag that is true if enabling a decoder, false if disabling a decoder.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.EnableAll
member.summary: Enables all available decoders so that barcodes with those symbologies will be decoded by the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.DisableAll
member.summary: Disables all available decoders so that barcodes with those symbologies will NOT be decoded by the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.EnableDefaults
member.summary: Resets decoders to their default enabled state. This is the state of the scanner drivers when the hardware is reset.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.DisableDefaults
member.summary: Disables all decoders that are enabled by default.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL
member.summary: The dpALL class provides access to parameters that are standard across all decoders. When these parameters are modified, all decoders are modified.
member.remarks: The dpALL class is normally constructed by the DecoderParamsAPI class, which is constructed by the Reader. Therefore, access to these parameters should be made through the Reader.Decoders.ALL property.

member.summary: The dpALL constructor should not normally be called.
member.param: The Reader object in which decoder information should come from.

member.summary: The Enabled property when set to true enables all decoders, when false all decoders are disabled.
member.value: Boolean flag that specifies state (true=enable,false=disable).

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.MinimumLength
member.summary: This property is not used. Returns 0 at all times.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.MaximumLength
member.summary: This property is not used. Returns 0 at all times.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpSIGNATURE.ImageFormat
member.summary: Requested image file format.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpSIGNATURE.ImageQuality
member.summary: Quality of compressed JPEG image. Range is 0 - 100, where 100 is highest quality image and 0 means optimize for image size. Note: JPEG image will be optimized for either Quality or Size. Size restrictions take priority over quality restrictions.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpSIGNATURE.ImageSize
member.summary: Maximum compressed JPEG image size in kilobytes (KB). 0 means optimize for image quality. Note: JPEG image will be optimized for either Quality or Size. Size restrictions take priority over quality restrictions.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpSIGNATURE.ImageWidth
member.summary: Specifies the desired output image width.
member.remarks: The aspect ratio of ImageWidth to ImageHeight must match the aspect ratio of the signature capture bar code. For example, a 4-by-1 inch signature capture area would require a 4-to-1 aspect ratio of the image width to height.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpSIGNATURE.ImageHeight
member.summary: Specifies the desired output image height.
member.remarks: The aspect ratio of ImageWidth to ImageHeight must match the aspect ratio of the signature capture bar code. For example, a 4-by-1 inch signature capture area would require a 4-to-1 aspect ratio of the image width to height.

member.summary: Returns the minimum length of a valid barcode for the decoder.
member.value: An integer, 0-55, representing the minimum size of the barcode.

member.summary: Returns the maximum length of a valid barcode for the decoder.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI
member.summary: The UPCEANParamsAPI class provides access to parameters that are available for the UPC and EAN decoders.
member.remarks: The UPCEANParamsAPI class is normally constructed by the Reader class and can be accessed through the Reader.UPCEANParams property. This class is derived from Symbol.API and can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The UPCEANParamsAPI constructor should not normally be called.
member.param: The Reader object from which decoder information should come from.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Text
member.summary: The Text property returns a friendly class name.
member.value: String returns "UPCEAN General".

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.SecurityLevel
member.summary: The UPC/EAN security level.
member.value: A member that indicates the type of security.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Supplemental2
member.summary: Flag to enable length 2 supplementals.
member.value: A member that indicates whether or not length 2 supplementals are enabled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Supplemental5
member.summary: Flag to enable length 5 supplementals.
member.value: A member that indicates whether or not length 5 supplementals are enabled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.SupplementalMode
member.summary: The supplemental mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.SupplementalRetries
member.summary: Retry count for auto-discriminating for supplementals. Possible values are 2 to 20 inclusive. Note that flag is only considered if is set to one of the following values: SUPPLEMENTALS_ AUTO, SUPPLEMENTALS_SMART, SUPPLEMENTALS_378_379, SUPPLEMENTALS_978_979, SUPPLEMENTALS_977 or SUPPLEMENTALS_414_419_434_439.
member.value: The number of retries. An integer type that can be 2 to 20 inclusive.

member.summary: Flag to enable Bookland code decoding.
member.value: A member that indicates whether or not Bookland decoding has been enabled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.CouponCode
member.summary: Flag to enable Coupon Code decoding.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.BooklandFormat

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.ConvertRSSToUPCEAN
member.summary: Flag to enable converting RSS barcodes to UPC/EAN format. For this setting to work UPC/EAN symbologies must be enabled

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.CouponReportMode
member.summary: Used to differentiate between old coupon (UPC/EAN and Code128) and new GS1 DataBar Coupons. NOTE: There is an Interim GS1 DataBar Coupon (UPC A and the GS1 DataBar), which is meant for smooth transition of adaption from old coupon format to new coupon format. If an interim coupon is presented to the scanner, it will read old or new potion of it, depending on the report mode setting.
member.value: A member that indicates the current coupon report mode.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI

member.remarks: The ScanParamsAPI class is normally constructed by the Reader class and can be accessed through the Reader.Parameters property. This class is derived from Symbol.API and can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI.LocalFeedback
member.summary: Flag to enable local feedback.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI.Feedback
member.summary: The Feedback property provides access to a LIST that contains the different types of notification events available when scanning. This list includes Success, Start, Proceed, Fail, among others.
member.value: Returns a object. This object provides a list of feedback types that can be modified.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI.FeedbackListPropertyInfo
member.summary: The FeedbackListPropertyInfo class provides access to a LIST of feedback types. Each feedback type will contain a separate set of parameters which can be modified to suit the needs of the scanning environment.
member.remarks: The FeedbackListPropertyInfo class is normally constructed by the ScanParamsAPI class and can be accessed through the Reader.Parameters.Feedback property. This class is derived from Symbol.API and can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: T:Symbol.Generic.Device

The Generic.Device class provides the basic functionality needed to obtain a list of available devices.
NOTE: This class has been deprecated.
member.remarks: This class is normally used to derive a specific class that contains more detailed device information. The basic information exposed by this class is used by the StandardForms UI to create device lists that are independent of the type of the devices in the list.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Device
member.summary: The Symbol.Barcode.Device class provides information about to all the available scanners in the system.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Barcode.Device class provides an excellent starting point for applications that wish to gain more information about all the scanners available. The AvailableDevices property provides a static Device array with each entry mapping to available scanning hardware. Each entry contains information about the hardware and can also be used to contruct a object. This is the recommended method for instantiating Reader objects.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Device.#ctor
member.summary: Default device class constructor.
member.remarks: By default, a Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the "SCN1:" scanner targeted. Its friendly name will be "Default Reader".

member.summary: Device class constructor with settable device name.
member.remarks: A Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the given Device Name. Its friendly name will be "Explicit Reader".
member.param: The name of the device (should be in the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner).

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Device.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Device class constructor with settable device name and friendly name.
member.remarks: A Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the given Device Name and Friendly Name.
member.param: The name of the device (should be in the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner).
A friendly name for the device. Can be any string.

The GetNextStatus() method is usually called when a StatusNotify event has been fired and your event processing method (EventHandler) has been invoked. During your event processing the BarcodeStatus object is obtained so that information about the status change can be retrieved.

member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable
member.summary: The Accessable base class is used by any derived class that encapsulates a native structure.
member.remarks: The Accessable class is derived from marshal object and therefore provides both a MarshalTo and UnmarshalFrom capability. Commonly an object derived from Accessable is accessed using the Indexers provided by this class. The index to indexers are constants that provide location information as to where in the native structure a MarshalObject resides. The derived Accessable object ususally takes on the form of an array of MarshalObjects that define the native structure in managed code.

member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject
member.summary: MarshalObject abstract base class provides a the capability of defining an object that can be passed between native and managed code or vice versa.
member.remarks: The MarshalObject is most commonly used to derive classes that will take the form of certain members inside of structures. (Examples: StringObject, FloatObject, etc.) These derived classes are used to fully describe the structure that will be marshalled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.MarshalTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MarshalTo method must be implemented by the derived class. When implemented, the method takes the managed information and marshals it into a native buffer that can be used with native function calls.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer value that indicates where in the native buffer the marshalled data should start being copied to.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be placed in the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset).

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.UnmarshalFrom(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnmarshalFrom method must be implemented by the derived class. When implemented, the method takes the native buffer and unmarshals it into managed information that can be used by the class libraries.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer offset from which to begin unmarshalling the data.

member.summary: No defined value type.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_SZ
member.summary: Null-terminated string. It will be a Unicode or ANSI string, depending on whether you use the Unicode or ANSI functions.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_EXPAND_SZ
member.summary: Null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables (for example, "%PATH%"). It will be a Unicode or ANSI string, depending on whether you use the Unicode or ANSI functions.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_BINARY
member.summary: Binary data in any form.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD
member.summary: 32-bit number.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD_LITTLE_ENDIAN
member.summary: 32-bit number in little-endian format. This is equivalent to REG_DWORD. In little-endian format, a multibyte value is stored in memory from the lowest byte (the "little end") to the highest byte. For example, the value 0x12345678 is stored as (0x78 0x56 0x34 0x12) in little-endian format.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN
member.summary: 32-bit number in big-endian format. In big-endian format, a multibyte value is stored in memory from the highest byte (the "big end") to the lowest byte. For example, the value 0x12345678 is stored as (0x12 0x34 0x56 0x78) in big-endian format.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_LINK
member.summary: Unicode symbolic link.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_MULTI_SZ
member.summary: Array of null-terminated strings that are terminated by two null characters.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.InterfaceParams
member.summary:
The InterfaceParams class holds the parameters for the interface to the attached bar code reader. Interface parameters are global to all reads on all open handles on the same scanner.
NOTE: Beginning with the ScanMDD file version 6.01, the InterfaceParameters object can be accessed before or after enabling the Reader object. In the earlier versions of ScanMDD, the InterfaceParameters object can only be accessed after enabling the Reader object. The ScanMDD version can be retrieved using the ControlPanel tool available on the support central website.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.InterfaceParams.InterfaceType
member.summary: Provides the interface type which determines the specific interface. Read only. This interface type determines the values for InterfaceSpecific.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.InterfaceParams.InterfaceSpecific
member.summary: The InterfaceSpecific holds parameters for one interface type. The value of InterfaceType determines which specific interface parameters to use.

member.summary: Lighthouse Interface

member.summary: Sampling clock divisor used for data acquisition. Possible values are 1 to 32 inclusive.

member.summary: Time in milliseconds after power is supplied before engine is ready for use. NOTE: Changing the default value is not recommended.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific
member.summary: Provides the SSI specific interface parameters

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.PowerSettlingTime
member.summary: Time in milliseconds after power is supplied before engine is ready for use. NOTE: Changing the default value is not recommended.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.PowerOffSettlingTime
member.summary: Time to wait before re-powering.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.EstablishConnectionTime
member.summary: Specifies the timeout (in seconds) that Reader.Actions.Enable() will block, before returning an error if a remote scanner connection is not established. In order to use this parameter, the user should set the required value to this property and call Reader.Actions.SetParameter(), before calling Actions.Enable(). NOTE: This is currently applicable only to Bluetooth scanners such as RS507.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.ConnectionIdleTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the timeout (in seconds), when a remote scanner is idle in a particular state (IDLE, WAITING, READY or AIMING), after which the connection between the mobile computer and the remote scanner is severed to conserve power. NOTE: This is currently applicable only to Bluetooth scanners such as RS507.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.BTDisconnectOnExit
member.summary: Specifies whether to disconnect any existing Bluetooth connection, between a remote Bluetooth scanner and the mobile computer, when disabling the Reader object. True - Disconnect existing Bluetooth connection after disabling the Reader object. False - Do not disconnect existing Bluetooth connection after disabling the Reader object. NOTE: This is currently applicable only to Bluetooth scanners such as RS507. Setting this parameter will only persist for one session. To use this feature effectively, it is best to set this permanently using Motorola's CtlPanel tool which can be obtained from the support central website.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.SSISpecific.DisplayBTAddressBarcode
member.summary: Displays the Bluetooth address of the mobile computer as a barcode, when calling Actions.Enable(). When using Bluetooth scanners such as RS507, the pairing process between the mobile computer and Bluetooth scanner may require scanning the Bluetooth address of the mobile computer. If this parameter is set to TRUE, the Bluetooth address will be displayed as a barcode when the enabling the Reader object. This feature eliminates the need to open external tools such as BT_Information in order to display the pairing barcode. NOTE: This is currently applicable only to Bluetooth scanners such as RS507.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData
member.summary: ReaderData class encapsulates all the scanned data and meta-data for a given read.
member.remarks: The ReaderData class is most commonly used to create objects that will be passed to the method. This will start a pending read.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.ReaderDataTypes,System.Int32)
member.summary: ReaderData constructor with integer based buffer size.
member.param: A member that specifies whether the memory buffer sent to the hardware will hold text or raw binary data.
An integer that specifies the size of the memory buffer in bytes for binary mode, in characters for text mode.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.ReaderDataTypes,Symbol.Barcode.ReaderDataLengths)
member.summary: ReaderData constructor with enumerated type buffer size.
member.param: A member that specifies whether the memory buffer sent to the hardware will hold text or raw binary data.
An integer that specifies the size of the memory buffer in bytes for binary mode, in characters for text mode.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a ReaderData to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Dispose
member.summary: Release all resources used by ReaderData object.
member.remarks:
It is highly recommended that this method be called when the ReaderData object is no longer being used by the application.
Note: Do not Dispose of the ReaderData object until any Reads associated with it have been cancelled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.ToString
member.summary: Returns the scanned data text.
member.returns: A string of the scanned data if the memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and they memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsText
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData memory buffer is set to text mode.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the memory buffer is set to text mode, otherwise the memory buffer is set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsPending
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData is currently in a pending read situation.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicate that the ReaderData has not completed a read that has been requested of it. Reads will be pending until they complete with a valid decode, fail with an error, or are cancelled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsAllocated
member.summary: Specifies whether or not a memory buffer has been allocated for the ReaderData. The memory buffer will be allocated after a read is issued using the Reader.Actions.Read(..) call.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that a valid memory buffer has been allocated, otherwise the memory buffer has not been allocated.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.BufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the memory buffer size allocated by the ReaderData.
member.value: An integer which specifies the memory buffer size in bytes for binary mode or characters for text mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Text
member.summary: Returns the scanned data text.
member.value: A string of the scanned data if the memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and they memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.RawData
member.summary: Returns a byte array with the scanned data.
member.value: A byte array with the scanned data if the ReaderDataType has been set to binary mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and ReaderDataType has been set to text mode in the constructor of ReaderData object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Source
member.summary: Returns the source of the scanned data. (ie The barcode scanner device name)
member.value: A string that contains the name of the scanner which provided the source.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time at which the barcode was scanned.
member.value: A DateTime structure that contains the time information.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Type
member.summary: The Decoder type of the barcode.
member.value: A member that specifies the type of barcode scanned.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.TypeHex
member.summary: The Decoder Type of the barcode in hexadecimal format.
member.value: A string of the form "0x#", where # is the decoder type in hexadecimal.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Length
member.summary: The length of the barcode data.
member.value: An integer that specifies the length of the scanned data.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.MultiPart
member.summary: The flag indicating whether the data is in the multi-part format. If this has been set to true, the user is supposed to get the auxiliary data.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxData
member.summary: Provides the access to the auxiliary data. The auxiliary data will be avaialble only if the flag MultiPart is true.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Event
member.summary: Not currently used, returns either "Scan Complete" or "".

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.HasReader
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData has been attached to a Reader object via a Actions.Read method call.
member.remarks: Note: This property will return true after a read has completed.
member.value: A boolean flag that when set to true indicates that the ReaderData has been attached to a Reader at some point.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.RequestId
member.summary: The ID of the read submitted to the barcode scanner hardware.
member.value: An integer that represents the ID of the requested read.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Result
member.summary: The result of the read request.
member.remarks: This result is a managed code version of the actual result returned by the underlying scan driver stack. It can be used to determine whether or not the read was successful or failed.
member.value: A member that indicates whether or not the read was successful.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxiliaryData
member.summary: Provides the access to the auxiliary data. This is meant to be used in conjunction with a ReaderData instance.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxiliaryData.ToString
member.summary: Returns the auxiliary data text.
member.returns: A string of the auxiliary data if the ReaderData memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and the ReaderData memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxiliaryData.Text
member.summary: Returns the auxiliary data text.
member.returns: A string of the auxiliary data if the ReaderData memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and the ReaderData memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxiliaryData.RawData
member.summary: Returns a byte array of the auxiliary data.
member.value: A byte array of the auxiliary data if the ReaderData memory buffer has been set to binary mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and ReaderDataType has been set to text mode in the constructor of ReaderData object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.AuxiliaryData.Length
member.summary: The length of the auxiliary data.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Info
member.summary: The Barcode.Info Class contains information about the scanner.
member.remarks: The Info class is normally constructed by the Reader class and can be accessed using the Reader.Info property.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Info.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The Info class constructor is not normally called.
member.param: A Reader object from which the information will be obtained.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the Reader is enabled.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the Reader is enabled, otherwise it is disabled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsSimulating
member.summary: Read only property returns whether or not the reader is in simulation mode.
member.remarks: Simulation mode is used primarily by the class libraries to allow support for programming using the "stock" emulators provided by Microsoft. While in simulation mode scans are faked so that programs can be tested and developed.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the Reader is in simulation mode, otherwise actual hardware has been targeted.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.PendingReads
member.summary: Returns the number of pending reads.
member.remarks: A pending read is a read that has been submitted but has not yet completed. To submit a pending read call the method. A read completes by either a successful decode, a failed decode, or due to a cancellation of the read.
member.value: An integer which returns the number of current pending reads.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.SoftTrigger
member.summary: The state of the soft-trigger.
member.remarks: A soft-trigger is a trigger that has been initiated via software. Unlike a hard trigger initiated by a physical button press.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true sets the state of the soft-trigger to on. If a read is pending then the laser will turn on. When the flag is set to false the laser will turn off.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.Decoders
member.summary: The list of decoders supported by the scan engine.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsBeamWidthSupported
member.summary: Flag telling whether the device supports narrow beam width. NOTE: This property is being deprecated. It will be removed in a future verison. Please use SupportedBeamWidths property instead.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsAimModeSupported
member.summary: Flag telling whether the device supports aiming.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsDirectionSupported
member.summary: Flag telling whether the device supports scan direction reporting.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsFeedbackSupported
member.summary: Flag telling whether the device supports remote (non-local) feedback.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.SupportedImageFormats
member.summary: The image formats supported.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.MaxImageRect
member.summary: Maximum image cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.DPMCapable
member.summary: Flag describing whether the scan engine is capable of decoding DPM bar codes.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.ViewFinderCapable
member.summary: Flag describing whether the scan engine supports a video viewfinder.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.AdaptiveScanning
member.summary: Flag describing whether this engine supports the adaptive scanning feature. NOTE: The adaptive scanning feature can be enabled/disabled using the Reader.ReaderParameters.ReaderSpecific.LaserSpecific.AdaptiveScanning property. Refer to this property's help page for important information about the Adaptive Scanning feature.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.SupportedBeamWidths
member.summary:
Provides a list of supported beam widths. The beam width parameter for the laser scanner can be modified using the Reader.ReaderParameters.ReaderSpecific.LaserSpecific.BeamWidth property. The beam width feature is not supported on Imager scanners.
NOTE: All laser scanners support BEAM_WIDTH.NORMAL by default. This array can be used by the application to query any other beam widths it may support.

member.name: T:Symbol.Resources

The location of the string.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.States
member.summary: Defines the different states of the barcode Reader.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.BT_CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED
member.summary: The Bluetooth Scanner is disconnected.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.BT_CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTED
member.summary: The Bluetooth Scanner is connected.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.STOPPED
member.summary: Scanner is not enabled.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.IDLE
member.summary: Scanner is enabled but no reads are pending.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.WAITING
member.summary: Scanner has one or more reads pending and is waiting for trigger event.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.READY
member.summary: Scanner beam is on and it is acquiring data.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.AIMING
member.summary: Scanner beam is on for aiming purposes.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.EMPTY
member.summary: Scanner beam is off waiting for Klasse Eins Gas Tank to recover.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.ERROR
member.summary: An error has occured.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.FIRST
member.summary: The first item in the States enumeration. This item is used during simulation mode to cycle through all states.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.States.LAST
member.summary: The last item in the States enumeration. This item is used during simulation mode to cycle through all states.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes
member.summary: Defines the different types of events that can occur for the barcode Reader.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.ERROR
member.summary: An error occurred while trying to wait for an event.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.STATE_CHANGE
member.summary: The state of the scanner has changed.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.ACTIVITY
member.summary: The scanner is busy/active. This event is used for image downloading activity and 2D hand-raster activity.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.IMAGE_CAPTURE
member.summary: The Scanner has captured an image and started to download.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.IMAGE_ERROR
member.summary: The Scanner has encountered a fatal error downloading an image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_START
member.summary: The Scanner has captured the first barcode in a concatenation sequence.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_CONTINUE
member.summary: The Scanner has captured another barcode in a concatenation sequence.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_FAIL
member.summary: The Scanner has encountered a fatal concatenation error.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_ERROR
member.summary: The Scanner has encountered a non-fatal concatenation error.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_DUPLICATE
member.summary: The Scanner has encountered a duplicate barcode in a concatenation sequence.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.SEQUENCE_INVALID
member.summary: The Scanner has encountered a barcode that is not part of the current concatenation sequence.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.BT_CONNECTION_STATE_CHANGE
member.summary: The connection state with Bluetooth scanner was changed.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.FIRST
member.summary: The first item in the EventTypes enumeration. This item is used during simulation mode to cycle through all event types.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes.LAST
member.summary: The last item in the EventTypes enumeration. This item is used during simulation mode to cycle through all event types.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes
member.summary: Describes the type of Code ID to be reported.
member.remarks:
The (legacy) Symbol Technologies Inc. CodeIDs are documented in the following table:
Code Type Symbol Tech. Identifier
UPC-A, UPC-E, UPC-E1, UPC-E0, EAN-13, EAN-8 A
Code 39, Code 39 Full ASCII, Code 32 B
Codabar C
Code 128, ISBT 128 D
Code 93 E
Interleaved 2 of 5 F
Discrete 2 of 5, D 2 of 5 IATA G
MSI Plessey J
UCC/EAN 128 K
Bookland EAN L
Trioptic Code 39 M
UPC/EAN Coupon Code N
PDF417 X
Data Matrix P00
QR Code, MicroQR P01
Maxicode P02
US Postnet P03
US Planet P04
Japan Postal P05
UK Postal P06
Australian Postal P09
Signature Capture P0X

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes.None
member.summary: No Code ID.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes.Symbol
member.summary: Use (legacy) Symbol Technologies Code ID.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes.AIM
member.summary: Use AIM Code ID.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes
member.summary: The type of scan requests.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Foreground
member.summary: Foreground reads take priorty over background reads. When submitting a foreground read the application should be the topmost window.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Background
member.summary: Background reads can be superceded by foreground reads. Background reads are usually submitted by background applications such as a scan wedge program.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Monitor
member.summary: Monitor reads provide a way in which programs can listen in on all scans that take place.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.DisabledEnabled.Enabled
member.summary: When Enabled, feedback is given locally. (e.g. at the Reader)

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN
member.summary: UPCEAN class provides a level of abstraction for specific enumerated types.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels
member.summary: The UPC/EAN security level.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.None
member.summary: No UPC/EAN security. This has been deprecated. Please use the value LEVEL0 instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.Ambiguous
member.summary: Check ambiguous characters. This has been deprecated. Please use the value LEVEL1 instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.All
member.summary: Check all characters. This has been deprecated. Please use the value LEVEL2 instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.LEVEL0
member.summary: This setting allows the digital scanner to operate in its most aggressive state, while providing sufficient security in decoding most “in-spec” bar codes.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.LEVEL1
member.summary: This default setting eliminates most misdecodes.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.LEVEL2
member.summary: Select this option if Security level 1 fails to eliminate misdecodes.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SecurityLevels.LEVEL3
member.summary: If you selected Security Level 2 and misdecodes still occur, select this security level. Be advised that selecting UPCEAN_SECURITY_LEVEL3 is an extreme measure against mis-decoding severely out of spec bar codes. Selecting this level of security significantly impairs the decoding ability of the digital scanner. Using improved quality of barcodes is preferable to using this level of security.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes
member.summary: The type of supplemental mode.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.None
member.summary: Supplementals ignored.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.Always
member.summary: Will not decode UPC/EAN without supplementals.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.Auto
member.summary: Auto-discriminates supplementals.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.Smart
member.summary: Enables smart supplementals. In this mode the decoder will return the decoded value of the main block right away if it does not belong to one of the following supplemental types: 378, 379, 977, 978, 979, 414, 419, 434, 439. If the barcode starts with one of the prefixes it will search the image more aggressively for a supplemental.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.S_378_379
member.summary: Enables (auto-discriminate) supplemental for UPC/EAN codes starting with 378 or 379. Will disable reading of supplementals for any other UPC/EAN barcode not starting with 378/379.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.S_978_979
member.summary: Enables (auto-discriminate) supplemental for UPC/EAN codes starting with 978 or 979. Will disable reading of supplementals for another UPC/EAN barcode not starting with 978/979.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.S_977
member.summary: Enables (auto-discriminate) supplemental for UPC/EAN codes starting with 977. Will disable reading of supplementals for another UPC/EAN barcode not starting with 977.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEAN.SupplementalModes.S_414_419_434_439
member.summary: Enables (auto-discriminate) supplemental for UPC/EAN codes starting with 414, 419, 434 or 439. Will disable reading of supplementals for another UPC/EAN barcode not starting with 414/419/434/439.
